accident_info.accident_description: Patient was rear-ended while stopped at red light on 3rd Avenue and 42nd Street. Airbags deployed. Patient wearing seatbelt.

chief_complaint: Neck pain, lower back pain, headache following motor vehicle accident
history_of_present_illness: 38 y/o female presents to ED via EMS following MVA approximately 2 hours ago. Patient was the restrained driver of a vehicle that was rear-ended while stopped at a traffic light. She reports immediate onset of neck pain and headache. She denies loss of consciousness. She reports pain radiating down her left arm. Back pain started approximately 30 minutes after the accident.

injuries.description: Tenderness to palpation over C4-C6 paraspinal muscles with decreased range of motion
Paraspinal muscle spasm L3-L5 with positive straight leg raise on left
Ecchymosis over left deltoid region from seatbelt

imaging_findings.findings: Loss of normal cervical lordosis. No fracture or dislocation identified. Mild disc space narrowing at C5-C6.
imaging_findings.impression: Cervical muscle spasm. Degenerative changes at C5-C6.

imaging_findings.findings: Normal lumbar lordosis. No acute fracture. Mild disc space narrowing at L4-L5.
imaging_findings.impression: No acute traumatic injury. Mild degenerative changes.

findings: HEENT: No signs of head trauma, pupils equal and reactive
Neck: Tenderness over posterior cervical paraspinal muscles C4-C6, decreased ROM in all planes
Back: Paraspinal tenderness L3-L5, positive straight leg raise left at 45 degrees
Neurological: 5/5 strength bilateral upper and lower extremities, sensation intact, DTRs 2+ and symmetric

work_restrictions: No prolonged sitting greater than 30 minutes

referrals.reason: Persistent headaches and left arm radiculopathy

follow_up.instructions: Return to ED for worsening pain, numbness, weakness, or difficulty walking

prognosis: Guarded. Patient will require ongoing treatment and therapy. Full recovery expected with appropriate treatment, though some patients develop chronic symptoms.
causation_statement: The injuries described above are consistent with and causally related to the motor vehicle accident that occurred on 03/15/2024.

supporting_language: Decreased ROM in all planes of cervical spine (44-56% loss)
Work restrictions preventing return to employment
Disability duration initially 2 weeks with likely extension
